00024 #ifndef _NIF_NODE_H_
00025 #define _NIF_NODE_H_
00026 
00027 #include "controlled.hpp"
00028 #include "data.hpp"

00030 namespace Nif
00031 {
00032 
00037 class Node : public Named
00038 {
00039 public:
00040   // Node flags. Interpretation depends somewhat on the type of node.
00041   int flags;
00042   const Transformation *trafo;
00043   PropertyList props;
00044 
00045   // Bounding box info
00046   bool hasBounds;
00047   const Vector *boundPos;
00048   const Matrix *boundRot;
00049   const Vector *boundXYZ; // Box size
00050 
00051   void read(NIFFile *nif)
00052   {
00053     Named::read(nif);
00054 
00055     flags = nif->getShort();
00056     trafo = nif->getTrafo();
00057     props.read(nif);
00058 
00059     hasBounds = !!nif->getInt();
00060     if(hasBounds)
00061       {
00062         nif->getInt(); // always 1
00063         boundPos = nif->getVector();
00064         boundRot = nif->getMatrix();
00065         boundXYZ = nif->getVector();
00066       }
00067 
00068     boneTrafo = NULL;
00069     boneIndex = -1;
00070   }
00071 
00072   // Bone transformation. If set, node is a part of a skeleton.
00073   const NiSkinData::BoneTrafo *boneTrafo;
00074 
00075   // Bone weight info, from NiSkinData
00076   const NiSkinData::BoneInfo *boneInfo;
00077 
00078   // Bone index. If -1, this node is either not a bone, or if
00079   // boneTrafo is set it is the root bone in the skeleton.
00080   short boneIndex;
00081 
00082   void makeRootBone(const NiSkinData::BoneTrafo *tr)
00083   {
00084     boneTrafo = tr;
00085     boneIndex = -1;
00086   }
00087 
00088   void makeBone(short ind, const NiSkinData::BoneInfo &bi)
00089   {
00090     boneInfo = &bi;
00091     boneTrafo = bi.trafo;
00092     boneIndex = ind;
00093   }
00094 };
00095 
00096 struct NiTriShapeCopy
00097 {
00098  std::string sname;
00099  std::vector<std::string> boneSequence;
00100  Nif::NiSkinData::BoneTrafoCopy trafo;
00101  //Ogre::Quaternion initialBoneRotation;
00102  //Ogre::Vector3 initialBoneTranslation;
00103  std::vector<Ogre::Vector3> vertices;
00104  std::vector<Ogre::Vector3> normals;
00105  std::vector<Nif::NiSkinData::BoneInfoCopy> boneinfo;
00106  std::map<int, std::vector<Nif::NiSkinData::IndividualWeight> > vertsToWeights;
00107  Nif::NiMorphData morph;
00108 };
00109 
00110 struct NiNode : Node
00111 {
00112   NodeList children;
00113   NodeList effects;
00114 
00115   /* Known NiNode flags:
00116 
00117      0x01 hidden
00118      0x02 use mesh for collision
00119      0x04 use bounding box for collision (?)
00120      0x08 unknown, but common
00121      0x20, 0x40, 0x80 unknown
00122    */
00123 
00124   void read(NIFFile *nif)
00125   {
00126     Node::read(nif);
00127     children.read(nif);
00128     effects.read(nif);
00129   }
00130 };
00131 
00132 struct NiTriShape : Node
00133 {
00134   /* Possible flags:
00135      0x40 - mesh has no vertex normals ?
00136 
00137      Only flags included in 0x47 (ie. 0x01, 0x02, 0x04 and 0x40) have
00138      been observed so far.
00139    */
00140 
00141   NiTriShapeDataPtr data;
00142   NiSkinInstancePtr skin;
00143 
00144   void read(NIFFile *nif)
00145   {
00146     Node::read(nif);
00147     data.read(nif);
00148     skin.read(nif);
00149   }
00150 
00151   NiTriShapeCopy clone(){
00152           NiTriShapeCopy copy;
00153       copy.sname = name.toString();
00154           float *ptr = (float*)data->vertices.ptr;
00155           float *ptrNormals = (float*)data->normals.ptr;
00156           int numVerts = data->vertices.length / 3;
00157           for(int i = 0; i < numVerts; i++)
00158           {
00159                    float *current = (float*) (ptr + i * 3);
00160                    copy.vertices.push_back(Ogre::Vector3(*current, *(current + 1), *(current + 2)));
00161 
00162                    if(ptrNormals){
00163                         float *currentNormals = (float*) (ptrNormals + i * 3);
00164                    copy.normals.push_back(Ogre::Vector3(*currentNormals, *(currentNormals + 1), *(currentNormals + 2)));
00165                           }
00166       }
00167 
00168 
00169   return copy;
00170   }
00171 };

00173 struct NiCamera : Node
00174 {
00175   struct Camera
00176   {
00177     // Camera frustrum
00178     float left, right, top, bottom, nearDist, farDist;
00179 
00180     // Viewport
00181     float vleft, vright, vtop, vbottom;
00182 
00183     // Level of detail modifier
00184     float LOD;
00185   };
00186 
00187   const Camera *cam;
00188 
00189   void read(NIFFile *nif)
00190   {
00191     Node::read(nif);
00192 
00193     nif->getPtr<Camera>();
00194 
00195     nif->getInt(); // -1
00196     nif->getInt(); // 0
00197   }
00198 };
